result.execSummary:
The defendant Dkota Milagrow Hawkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay a fine of $300 plus costs, assessments and surcharges by 6-15-15 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection. Provide a DNA sample, and pay the DNA surcharge.

Court advises the defendant may not possess a firearm.
Court advised the defendant cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dkota Milagrow Hawkins

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeds.   Statements by counsel and defendant.

Court advises the defendant may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample, and pay the DNA surcharge, if not previously done, and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to a fine of $300 plus costs, assessments and surcharges by 6-15-15 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge, if not already done.

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement received and filed.

Defendant Dkota Milagrow Hawkins in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Dkota Milagrow Hawkins in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

  Plea hearing scheduled for June 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Attorney Alejandro A Lockwood in court, defendant Dkota Milagrow Hawkins not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant is in custody on a VOP hold.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dkota Milagrow Hawkins in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Defendant Dkota Milagrow Hawkins in custody.  Paul Hauer for Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  To be monitored by drug testing.   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Dkota Milagrow Hawkins in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Defendant Dkota Milagrow Hawkins in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
